comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Charlotte Walker was an actress. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlotte_Walker_(actress) EUGENE WALTER TO MARRY.; Charlotte Walker Admits Her Engagement to Him, and He Confirms It. From NYT, November 26, 1908 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C03E3DA1739E333A... IBDB -- www.ibdb.com/person.php?id=63786 -- says they were married roughly 1910-1930 Walker was an actress and Walter a journalist who became a playwright. In January 1912, he starred in his "Trail of the Lonesome Pine." This picture may be associated with a case reported in the NYT of October 18, 1912 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C03E5DC133CE633A... She, her husband, and Mrs. Donald Brian were in court after Walker (Mrs. Walter) had woken in the Walters' Algonquin Hotel apartment to find a man standing by her bed. Mrs. Donald Brian may be the wife of another actor, en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Brian. If so, she was formerly Mrs Charles Pope, according to NYT on September 7, 1911 and had recently become an actress herself. She was the daughter of Joseph J. Gleason of Westchester County. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D0CE6DA1E3EE033A...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of January 22, 1910 gives Mrs. Donald Brian's first name as Florence. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D03EEDB1E30E333A...
